file_content.text: You helped save our village. Now it's time for you to go.
The ghosts of the desert are gone, and the wind is still. The village is secure.
All right. Incinerate the corpses.
Yes, brother.
You. You saved our village. You know the sands well.
Now that it's all over... do we start fighting again?
What happens next?
No. We don't.
There was no choice about it.
To your credit.
I don't need your gratitude, tribal.
Don't patronize me.
No. I imagine you don't.
It will take time to rebuild the settlement--time we shouldn't spend in pointless battle. You acted honorably, and the blood feud can end.
You don't know how pleased I am to hear that.
I'm glad.
Don't tell me you want to be my friend.
Let's not get too soft.
No. Only to remember you as an honorable foe from a battle long past.
What if I choose to be your enemy?
The feud doesn't have to end.
Then we'll fight when the day comes. I hope you choose otherwise.
However... I can't help suspecting you caused this attack. Intentionally or not, you awakened the desert's terrors.
Leave our settlement. Leave Tatooine altogether. Never let us see you here again.
Every second we waste, more Sons are being transformed.
You!
I knew the Empire used dishonorable tactics, but the ghost of the desert--do you know what it does to people?
What do you mean, "ghost of the desert"?
Ghost?
An old Jawa legend. A myth that kills with a touch.
Listen to me. The Empire isn't responsible for this attack.
That's not an Imperial weapon.
It's a coincidence, then?
The transformation is impressive.
Oh, yes.
Within the first minute, that terror changed good villagers into murderous machines.
There's a war going on in these caves. Now, I'll give my brothers the chance to win by keeping you from interfering.
You'll die--along with everyone else in this village.
You can't stop me.
Ha! For Palawa, I'll fight until our blood becomes an oasis!
To destroy those monsters, you'll need my help.
We should be allies.
You began this feud! Why would you help now?
This is the right thing to do. That should be enough.
I'm no murderer.
Never thought you were going to say that.
I tire of fighting for scholars and archaeologists. This will be glorious.
It'll be a good battle.
Well, now you can fight with some real warriors.
Helping you amuses me--for the moment.
It's my whim.
Blasted Sith. But I'm in no position to turn you down.
I have my reasons, but I'm not the sharing type.
Not your concern.
All right. Keep your motives to yourself, then.
I understand honor. You're not my enemy today.
You and I live by a code.
Huh. Maybe there's something to you after all.
There's no challenge in fighting a doomed enemy.
Killing you now is too easy.
If you really want to assist, I'll tell the others to let you through--least until the crisis is over.
If we destroy the ghosts fast enough, maybe we can stop them from replicating. But if even one survives... we start all over again.
Get out of here.
